column4: Can anyone tell me any info on ubuntu and the iPhone before I try makin my lappy a Linux box
what about a solution that doesn't use virtualiztion of windows the laptop isn't good enough to run vms
Intel Graphics card... thats all lspci tells me
What is the output of this command: glxinfo | grep "direct rendering"
Could you pastebin the outpu from "dmesg | grep drm"
dmesg | grep drm returns no results
Ok, that means that you aren't using Kernel Mode Setting for some reason (it may have been blacklisted for cards similar to yours). Enabling KMS may get you better performance.
btw, /var/log/kern.log is huge and full of lines similar to Jun 21 14:53:53 juggalo-laptop kernel: [ 3107.237522] hda-intel: spurious response 0x0:0x0, last cmd=0x270600
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/X/Bugs/Lucidi8xxFreezes  explains how to re-enable KMS, though there is a chance that will cause hard locks with your hardware.

im not quite sure this is a i8xx chip tho.... output of lspci for VGA is: 00:02.0 VGA compatible controller [0300]: Intel Corporation System Controller Hub (SCH Poulsbo) Graphics Controller [8086:8108] (rev 07)
Poulsbo has notoriously bad linux support.
i was afraid you were gonna say that :-/
any suggestions for this video card? :-) i really dont wanna scrap the ubuntu idea
